mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Wants Gardiner to see him on his way back to New York as there are many things of "vast importance" about which they should discuss; reports that Broderick wants the Secretary of Treasury to act in his behalf; Tyler feels that this is an extremely important matter and thinks that the President should be informed of it. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, no year November 12, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Alexander Gardiner, Washington City, D.C.
